protocol_name: RNA based library preparation for high through-put full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms
protocol_name_html: RNA based library preparation for high through-put full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms
description:
This protocol describes the preparation of Illumina libraries for high through-put sequencing of full-length SSU rRNA sequences from all domains of life without primer bias.

 

Sequences for primers and adaptor used can be found under guidelines.
protocol_affiliation: Center for Microbial Communities, Department of Chemistry and Bioscience, Aalborg University, Denmark
manuscript_citation: Karst, S. M., Dueholm, M. S., Mcilroy, S. J., Kirkegaard, R. H., & Nielsen, P. H. (2016). Thousands of primer-free , high-quality , full-length SSU rRNA sequences from all domains of life, 10(June), 1–13. https://doi.org/10.1101/070771

groups.group_name: Center for Microbial Communities, Aalborg University

guidelines:
Primers and adaptors used for library preparation:

Oligo name sequence Purification
SSU_rRNA_RT1 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNTCGCCTTAACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT2 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNCTAGTACGACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT3 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNTTCTGCCTACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT4 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNGCTCAGGAACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT5 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNAGGAGTCCACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT6 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNCATGCCTAACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT7 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNGTAGAGAGACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT8 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNCCTCTCTGACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT9 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNAGCGTAGCACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_RT10 AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNCAGCCTCGACTTGCCTGTCGCTCTATCTTCTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN PAGE
SSU_rRNA_s  /5Phos/GGGCAATATCAGCACCAACAGAAA/3SpC3/ HPLC
SSU_rRNA_l CTCCACCCAGACTCATCCATNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNATAGAGGCTTTCTGTTGGTGCTGATATTGC PAGE
SSU_rRNA_pcr_rv  AGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGAT HPLC
SSU_rRNA_pcr_fw CTCCACCCAGACTCATCCAT HPLC
SSU_rRNA_readtag_rv  CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATGTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCTAGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGAT PAGE
SSU_rRNA_readtag_fw CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATGTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCTCTCCACCCAGACTCATCCAT PAGE
SSU_rRNA_linktag_rv  CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATCGGTCTCGGCATTCCTGCTGAACCGCTCTTCCGATCTGCAATATCAGCACCAACAGAAA PAGE
SSU_rRNA_linktag_fw AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCTGAAGATAGAGCGACAGGCAAGT PAGE
SSU_rRNA_read2_rv GCTCTTCCGATCTAGGGGGGCAAAGATGAAGAT  HPLC
SSU_rRNA_read2_fw GCTCTTCCGATCTCTCCACCCAGACTCATCCAT  HPLC

components.data: Dilute the RNA to 40 ng/μL with nuclease-free water and transfer 25 μL to a 200 μL PCR tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute the RNA to 40 ng/μL with nuclease-free water and transfer 25 μL to a 200 μL PCR tube.

components.data: Heat denature the RNA at 70°C for 5 min. Snap cool the sample on an ice block for 2 min to prevent RNA from refolding. Immediately proceed to the next step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Heat denature the RNA at 70°C for 5 min. Snap cool the sample on an ice block for 2 min to prevent RNA from refolding. Immediately proceed to the next step.

components.data:
Isolated the SSU rRNA from total RNA by size selection on an E-gel electrophoresis system with a precast E-Gel CloneWell gel (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of the heat denatured RNA (800 ng total RNA)
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the SSU peak (ca. 1,500 bp) is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 16 aliquots, and the visible passing of the SSU rRNA peak.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 8 pooled aliquots per sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Isolated the SSU rRNA from total RNA by size selection on an E-gel electrophoresis system with a precast E-Gel CloneWell gel (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of the heat denatured RNA (800 ng total RNA)
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the SSU peak (ca. 1,500 bp) is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 16 aliquots, and the visible passing of the SSU rRNA peak.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 8 pooled aliquots per sample.

components.data: Analyze the pooled aliquots on an Agilent 2200 Tapestation with the High Sensitivity RNA Screen tape and pool the aliquots that contains the SSU rRNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Analyze the pooled aliquots on an Agilent 2200 Tapestation with the High Sensitivity RNA Screen tape and pool the aliquots that contains the SSU rRNA.

components.data:
Purify the sample using RNAClean XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 32 μL nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

components.data:
Prepare the poly(A) tailing reaction in a 200 µL PCR tube:

  • 30 µL sample from above (10 – 200 ng SSU rRNA)
  • 4 µL 10X E. coli Poly(A) Polymerase Reaction Buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 4 µL 10 mM ATP (New England Biolabs )
  • 1.5 µL E. coli Poly(A) Polymerase (New England Biolabs )
  • 1 µL RiboLock RNase Inhibitor (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the poly(A) tailing reaction in a 200 µL PCR tube:

  • 4 µL 10X E. coli Poly(A) Polymerase Reaction Buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 4 µL 10 mM ATP (New England Biolabs )
  • 1.5 µL E. coli Poly(A) Polymerase (New England Biolabs )
  • 1 µL RiboLock RNase Inhibitor (Thermo Fisher Scientific)

  • Elude in 15 μL nuclease-free water

source_data.annotation:
If the concentration of the sample is below 2 ng/µL use it as it is.

We have prepared successful libraries with as little as 0.45 ng/μL.
source_data.thread_text:
If the concentration of the sample is below 2 ng/µL use it as it is.

We have prepared successful libraries with as little as 0.45 ng/μL.
source_data.body:
If the concentration of the sample is below 2 ng/µL use it as it is.

We have prepared successful libraries with as little as 0.45 ng/μL.

components.data:
Prepare the adaptor priming reaction in a 200 µL PCR tube:

  • 11.5 µL sample from above (5 - 23 ng polyadenylated SSU rRNA)
  • 0.5 µL 100 µM SSU_rRNA_RT
  • 1 µL 10 mM dNTP mix
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the adaptor priming reaction in a 200 µL PCR tube:

  • 11.5 µL sample from above (5 - 23 ng polyadenylated SSU rRNA)
  • 0.5 µL 100 µM SSU_rRNA_RT
  • 1 µL 10 mM dNTP mix

components.data:
Prepare the first strand cDNA synthesis reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 13 μL sample from above
  • 4 µL 5x SSIV buffer (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL 200 U/µL SuperScript IV Reverse Transcriptase (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL 100 mM DTT (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL RiboLock RNase Inhibitor (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the first strand cDNA synthesis reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 13 μL sample from above
  • 4 µL 5x SSIV buffer (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL 200 U/µL SuperScript IV Reverse Transcriptase (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL 100 mM DTT (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL RiboLock RNase Inhibitor (Thermo Fisher Scientific)

components.data: Perform cDNA synthesis at 50°C for 50 min, inactivate the reaction at 80°C for 10 min, and finally cool the sample to 37°C. Proceed immediately to the next step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform cDNA synthesis at 50°C for 50 min, inactivate the reaction at 80°C for 10 min, and finally cool the sample to 37°C. Proceed immediately to the next step.

components.data: Add 1 µL 10 U/μL Ribonuclease H, from E. coli (cloned) (Thermo Fisher Scientific) to the cDNA from above, and incubate the sample at 37°C for 20 min to remove the RNA template.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 µL 10 U/μL Ribonuclease H, from E. coli (cloned) (Thermo Fisher Scientific) to the cDNA from above, and incubate the sample at 37°C for 20 min to remove the RNA template.

components.data:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 11 μL nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 11 μL nuclease-free water

components.data:
Prepare the single stranded adapter ligation reaction in  a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 8.25 µL sample from above
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_s
  • 5 µL 10x custom T4 RNA ligase buffer (500 mM Tris-HCl, 100 mM MgCl2, 10 mM hexamminecobalt(III) chloride, 200 µM ATP, pH 8.0)
  • 31.25 µL 40% (wt/wt) PEG 8000 (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 0.5 µL 1 mg/mL BSA (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 2.5 µL 10 U/µL T4 RNA ligase (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the single stranded adapter ligation reaction in  a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 8.25 µL sample from above
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_s
  • 5 µL 10x custom T4 RNA ligase buffer (500 mM Tris-HCl, 100 mM MgCl2, 10 mM hexamminecobalt(III) chloride, 200 µM ATP, pH 8.0)
  • 31.25 µL 40% (wt/wt) PEG 8000 (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 0.5 µL 1 mg/mL BSA (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 2.5 µL 10 U/µL T4 RNA ligase (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
Perform ligation at 22°C overnight.

components.data:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 50 μL nuclease-free water
  • Repeat the purification with 1.0x beads and elude in 12 μL nuclease-free water

source_data.annotation: High amounts of PEG-8000 in the samples prevents stringent size selection during the AMPure XP purification. A two step AMPure purification is therefore performed to ensure the removal of free adaptor oligoes.
source_data.thread_text: High amounts of PEG-8000 in the samples prevents stringent size selection during the AMPure XP purification. A two step AMPure purification is therefore performed to ensure the removal of free adaptor oligoes.

Perform polyadenylation at 37°C for 30 min.

components.data:
Prepare the second strand cDNA synthesis reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 10 µL sample from above
  • 26.75 µL nuclease free water
  • 5 µL 10x PCR Buffer (Qiagen)
  • 1 µL 10 mM dNTP (Qiagen)
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_l
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_pcr_rv
  • 2 µL 25 mM MgCl2
  • 0.25 µL 5 U/µL Taq polymerase (Qiagen)

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 20 of RNA based library preparation for high through-put full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms

source_data.annotation: Why do you use a non-proofreading polymerase? Have you ever tried using a proofreading polymerase e.g. Phusion or Q5? Is there any distinct disadvantage using these?
source_data.thread_text: Why do you use a non-proofreading polymerase? Have you ever tried using a proofreading polymerase e.g. Phusion or Q5? Is there any distinct disadvantage using these?
source_data.body: Why do you use a non-proofreading polymerase? Have you ever tried using a proofreading polymerase e.g. Phusion or Q5? Is there any distinct disadvantage using these?

comments.name: Morten Simonsen Dueholm
comments.comment_text: We tried to use a proofreading polymerase when we developed the method. However, we found that this polymerase resulted in many chimeras and strange products, probably due to the nuclease activity of the proofreading domain, as we observed partly digested molecular tags in the raw sequencing data.
comments.body: We tried to use a proofreading polymerase when we developed the method. However, we found that this polymerase resulted in many chimeras and strange products, probably due to the nuclease activity of the proofreading domain, as we observed partly digested molecular tags in the raw sequencing data.

components.data: Perform the second strand cDNA syntheis with an initial denaturation at 94°C for 3 min, followed by 2 cycles of denaturation at 94°C for 30 s, annealing at 56°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 3 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the second strand cDNA syntheis with an initial denaturation at 94°C for 3 min, followed by 2 cycles of denaturation at 94°C for 30 s, annealing at 56°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 3 min.

components.data:
Prepare a single-standed DNA digestion reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 23 µL sample from above
  • 3 µL 10X S1 nuclease buffer (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 3 µL 3 M NaCl (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
  • 1 µL 10 U/µL S1 nuclease (Thermo Fisher Scientific)

components.data: Analyze the PCR product on an Agilent 2200 Tapestation using a D5000 screen tape.
components.name: Description

components.data:
Isolated the full-length SSU PCR products by size selection on an E-gel electrophoresis system with precast E-Gel CloneWell gels (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of sample from above (100-300 ng of PCR product)
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the SSU peak (ca. 1,500 bp) is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 16 aliquots, and the visible passing of the full-length SSU cDNA peak.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 8 pooled aliquots per sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Isolated the full-length SSU PCR products by size selection on an E-gel electrophoresis system with precast E-Gel CloneWell gels (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of sample from above (100-300 ng of PCR product)
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the SSU peak (ca. 1,500 bp) is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 16 aliquots, and the visible passing of the full-length SSU cDNA peak.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 8 pooled aliquots per sample.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 34 of RNA based library prepartion for full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms
source_data.protocol_name: RNA based library preparation for high through-put full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA based library preparation for high through-put full-length small ribosomal RNA sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq and HiSeq platforms
source_data.annotation:
The number of amplicons in the primary library can be calculated using the following formula:

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 ) / ( length in bp * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 )/ ( 1800 * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number =  amount in ng * 5.15x108 copies/ng
source_data.thread_text:
The number of amplicons in the primary library can be calculated using the following formula:

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 ) / ( length in bp * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 )/ ( 1800 * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number =  amount in ng * 5.15x108 copies/ng
source_data.body:
The number of amplicons in the primary library can be calculated using the following formula:

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 ) / ( length in bp * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number = ( amount in ng * 6.022x1023 )/ ( 1800 * 1x109 * 650 ) =>

number =  amount in ng * 5.15x108 copies/ng

components.data:
Prepare a clonal library amplification reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 10 µL sample from above
  • 63.5 µL nuclease-free water
  • 10 µL 10x PCR buffer (Qiagen)
  • 2 µL 10 mM dNTP (Qiagen)
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_pcr_fw
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_pcr_rv
  • 4 µL 25 mM MgCl (Qiagen)
  • 0.5 µL 5 U/µL Taq polymerase (Qiagen)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare a clonal library amplification reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 10 µL sample from above
  • 63.5 µL nuclease-free water
  • 10 µL 10x PCR buffer (Qiagen)
  • 2 µL 10 mM dNTP (Qiagen)
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_pcr_fw
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_pcr_rv
  • 4 µL 25 mM MgCl (Qiagen)
  • 0.5 µL 5 U/µL Taq polymerase (Qiagen)

components.data: Perform the PCR with an initial denaturation at 94°C for 3 min, followed by 25 (MiSeq) or 20 (HiSeq) cycles of denaturation at 94°C for 30 s, annealing at 62°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 2 min and then a final extension at 72°C for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the PCR with an initial denaturation at 94°C for 3 min, followed by 25 (MiSeq) or 20 (HiSeq) cycles of denaturation at 94°C for 30 s, annealing at 62°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 2 min and then a final extension at 72°C for 5 min.

components.data:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 0.6x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 20 μL nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

components.data:
Determine the concentration of the clonal library on a Qubit 2.0 fluorometer with the Qubit dsDNA HS Assay kit.

  • Use 1 μL sample
  • Perform duplicate measurements

components.data: Dilute the clonal library to 4.35 ng/μL with nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute the clonal library to 4.35 ng/μL with nuclease-free water

components.data:
A Nextera library preparation kit (Illumina) is used to prepare a paired-end read-tag sequencing library from the clonal library using a customized protocol.

 

Prepare a tagmentation reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 23 μL diluted clonal library from above
  • 12.5 µL tagment DNA buffer (Illumina)
  • 1.5 µL tagment DNA enzyme (Illumina)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
A Nextera library preparation kit (Illumina) is used to prepare a paired-end read-tag sequencing library from the clonal library using a customized protocol.

 

Prepare a tagmentation reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 23 μL diluted clonal library from above
  • 12.5 µL tagment DNA buffer (Illumina)
  • 1.5 µL tagment DNA enzyme (Illumina)

components.data: Perform the tagmentation incubated at 55°C for 5 min. Immediately proceed to the next step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the tagmentation incubated at 55°C for 5 min. Immediately proceed to the next step.

components.data:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Dilute the sample to 100 μL with nuclease-free water (63 μL)
  • Use 0.6x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 42 μL nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Dilute the sample to 100 μL with nuclease-free water (63 μL)
  • Use 0.6x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 42 μL nuclease-free water

components.data:
The tagmentation products are PCR amplified using two separate PCRs (A and B). PCR A selectively amplified fragments containing the 5’ termini of the cDNA amplicons and PCR B selectively amplified fragments containing the 3’ termini.

 

Prepare the PCR reactions in 200 μL PCR tubes:

  • 20 μL of sample from above
  • 5 µL N504 nextera adaptor (Illumina)
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_readtag_fw (PCR A) or SSU_rRNA_readtag_rv (PCR B)
  • 15 µL Nextera PCR master mix (Illumina)
  • 5 µL PCR primer cocktail (Illumina)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The tagmentation products are PCR amplified using two separate PCRs (A and B). PCR A selectively amplified fragments containing the 5’ termini of the cDNA amplicons and PCR B selectively amplified fragments containing the 3’ termini.

 

Prepare the PCR reactions in 200 μL PCR tubes:

  • 20 μL of sample from above
  • 5 µL N504 nextera adaptor (Illumina)
  • 5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_readtag_fw (PCR A) or SSU_rRNA_readtag_rv (PCR B)
  • 15 µL Nextera PCR master mix (Illumina)
  • 5 µL PCR primer cocktail (Illumina)

components.data: Perform the PCR with an initial elongation at 72°C for 3 min, denaturation at 98°C for 3 s, followed by 10 cycles of denaturation at 98°C for 10 s, annealing at 60°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 3 min and then a final extension at 72°C for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the PCR with an initial elongation at 72°C for 3 min, denaturation at 98°C for 3 s, followed by 10 cycles of denaturation at 98°C for 10 s, annealing at 60°C for 30 s, and extension at 72°C for 3 min and then a final extension at 72°C for 5 min.

components.data:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 20 μL nuclease-free water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Purify the sample using AMPure XP beads:

  • Perform purification in a 2 mL Eppedorf tube
  • Use 1.0x beads
  • Wash 2x with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
  • Elude in 20 μL nuclease-free water

components.data:
Size selection the read-tag libraries on an E-gel electrophoresis system with precast E-Gel CloneWell gels (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of sample from above 
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the 500 bp marker is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 32 aliquots, and the visible passing of the 1500 bp marker.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 16 pooled aliquots per sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Size selection the read-tag libraries on an E-gel electrophoresis system with precast E-Gel CloneWell gels (Thermo Fisher Scientific):

  • Use 20 μL of sample from above 
  • Use 500 ng GeneRuler 1 kB DNA ladder (Thermo Fisher Scientific) as a reference.
  • Run the gel until the 500 bp marker is approximately 1 mm from the the elution well. 
  • Now collect 20 µL elution aliquots every 15 seconds, up to a total of 32 aliquots, and the visible passing of the 1500 bp marker.
  • Pool every two aliquots to obtain 16 pooled aliquots per sample.

source_data.annotation: This size selection is perform in order to normalize the read-tag libraries with respect to sequencing efficiency. This results in even coverage of the full-length SSU molecules during the assembly.

components.data: Determine the size and the concentration of each fraction on an Agilent 2200 Tapestation with the High Sensitivity D1000 Screentape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Determine the size and the concentration of each fraction on an Agilent 2200 Tapestation with the High Sensitivity D1000 Screentape.

components.data:
Calculate the effective sequencing concentration for each fraction based on the tapestation data and the empirical formula:

Cseq = Peak molarity [pmol/l] * (-0.0124*(peak size [bp] – 215 bp) + 10.332).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Calculate the effective sequencing concentration for each fraction based on the tapestation data and the empirical formula:

Cseq = Peak molarity [pmol/l] * (-0.0124*(peak size [bp] – 215 bp) + 10.332).

components.data: Pool equal sequencing capacity of each fractions with an average size of 550-1200 bp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool equal sequencing capacity of each fractions with an average size of 550-1200 bp.

components.data:
Prepare a clonal library end-repair reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 4.6 µL diluted clonal library from step 40
  • 16.65 µL nuclease-free water
  • 2.5 µL 10X NEBNext End repair Reaction Buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 1.25 µL NEBNext End Repair Enzyme Mix (New England Biolabs)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare a clonal library end-repair reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 4.6 µL diluted clonal library from step 40
  • 16.65 µL nuclease-free water
  • 2.5 µL 10X NEBNext End repair Reaction Buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 1.25 µL NEBNext End Repair Enzyme Mix (New England Biolabs)
Perform end-repair at 20°C for 30 min.

components.data:
Prepare a intramolecular blunt-end ligation reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 2 µL sample from above
  • 150 µL nuclease-free water
  • 20 µL 50% (w/w) PEG 4000 solution (New England Biolabs)
  • 20 µL 10X T4 DNA ligase buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 8 µL T4 DNA ligase (New England Biolabs)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare a intramolecular blunt-end ligation reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 2 µL sample from above
  • 150 µL nuclease-free water
  • 20 µL 50% (w/w) PEG 4000 solution (New England Biolabs)
  • 20 µL 10X T4 DNA ligase buffer (New England Biolabs)
  • 8 µL T4 DNA ligase (New England Biolabs)
Perform ligation at 16°C for 1 hr.

components.data:
Prepare a junction amplification reaction in a 200 μL PCR tube:

  • 8 µL sample from above
  • 5 µL 10x PCR buffer (Qiagen)
  • 1 µL 10 mM dNTP (Qiagen)
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_linktag_fw
  • 2.5 µL 10 µM SSU_rRNA_linktag_rv
  • 3µL 25 mM MgCl (Qiagen)
  • 30.25 µL nuclease-free water
  • 0.25 µL 5 U/µL Taq polymerase (Qiagen)
components.name: Description
